mapper.insert: insert into tbl_pet_owner (pid, p_user_name, p_password, p_phone, p_email, p_name, p_type, p_breed, p_age, p_status, grade) values (#{pid,jdbcType=CHAR}, #{pUserName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{pPassword,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{pPhone,jdbcType=CHAR}, #{pEmail,jdbcType=CHAR}, #{pName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{pType,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{pBreed,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{pAge,jdbcType=CHAR}, #{pStatus,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{grade,jdbcType=CHAR})
mapper.update: update tbl_pet_owner set p_user_name = #{pUserName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, p_password = #{pPassword,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, p_phone = #{pPhone,jdbcType=CHAR}, p_email = #{pEmail,jdbcType=CHAR}, p_name = #{pName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, p_type = #{pType,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, p_breed = #{pBreed,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, p_age = #{pAge,jdbcType=CHAR}, p_status = #{pStatus,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, grade = #{grade,jdbcType=CHAR} where pid = #{pid,jdbcType=CHAR}
mapper.select: select pid, p_user_name, p_password, p_phone, p_email, p_name, p_type, p_breed, p_age, p_status, grade from tbl_pet_owner where pid = #{pid,jdbcType=CHAR}
select pid, p_user_name, p_password, p_phone, p_email, p_name, p_type, p_breed, p_age, p_status, grade from tbl_pet_owner
SELECT pid, p_user_name, p_password, p_phone, p_email, p_name, p_type, p_breed, p_age, p_status, grade FROM tbl_pet_owner WHERE p_user_name=#{pUserName} AND p_password=#{pPassword}
